contentrichtext.text: {{italic title}} {{Taxobox | name = ''Ctenophorus'' | image = Ctenophorus fordi.jpg | image_caption = [[Ctenophorus fordi]] (''Mallee Dragon'') | regnum = [[Animal]]ia | phylum = [[Chordate|Chordata]] | subphylum = [[Vertebrate|Vertebrata]] | classis = [[Reptile|Reptilia]] | ordo = [[Squamata]] | subordo = [[Iguania]] | familia = [[Agamidae]] | subfamilia = [[Agaminae]] | genus = '''''Ctenophorus''''' | genus_authority = [[Leopold Fitzinger|Fitzinger]], 1843<ref>Dahms Tierleben. www.dahmstierleben.de.</ref> | subdivision_ranks = [[Species]] | subdivision = ca. 25 species, see text }} [[File:Central Netted Dragon closeup at Sydney Wildlife World.jpg|thumb|left|[[Ctenophorus nuchalis]] (''Central Netted Dragon'') ]] '''''Ctenophorus''''', also known as '''comb-bearing dragons''', is a [[genus]] of [[lizard]]s that contains the most diverse group of [[Agamidae|dragons]] in [[Australia]]. Many of these have been grouped by a similar [[morphology (biology)|morphology]]. The informal names and groupings within this genus — Rock or Crevice-dragon, Ground, Sand-dragon, and Bicycle-dragon — are named after the mythological creature, the [[dragon]]. ==Species== Listed alphabetically by [[Specific name (zoology)|specific name]].<ref>[http://reptile-database.reptarium.cz/search.php?taxon=&genus=Ctenophorus&submit=Search ''Ctenophorus''], The Reptile Database</ref> *''[[Ctenophorus adelaidensis]]'' <small>([[John Edward Gray|Gray]], 1841)</small> – Western Heath Dragon *''[[Ctenophorus caudicinctus]]'' <small>([[Albert Günther|Günther]], 1875)</small> – Ring-tailed Bicycle-dragon, Ring-tailed Dragon *''[[Ctenophorus clayi]]'' <small>([[Glen Milton Storr|Storr]], 1967)</small> – Black-shouldered Ground-dragon, Black-collared Dragon *''[[Ctenophorus cristatus]]'' <small>(Gray 1841)</small> – Crested Bicycle-dragon, Crested Dragon, Bicycle Dragon *''[[Ctenophorus decresii]]'' <small>([[André Marie Constant Duméril|A.M.C. Duméril]] & [[Gabriel Bibron|Bibron]], 1837)</small> – Tawny Crevice-dragon, Tawny Dragon *''[[Ctenophorus femoralis]]'' <small>(Storr, 1965)</small> – Long-tailed Sand-dragon *''[[Ctenophorus fionni]]'' <small>([[Joan Beauchamp Procter|Procter]], 1923)</small> – Peninsula Crevice-dragon, Peninsula Dragon *''[[Ctenophorus fordi]]'' <small>(Storr, 1965)</small> – Mallee Dragon, Mallee Sand-dragon, Mallee Military Dragon *''[[Ctenophorus gibba]]'' <small>(Houston, 1974)</small> – Bulldust Ground-dragon, Gibber Dragon *''[[Ctenophorus isolepis]]'' <small>(Fischer, 1881)</small> – Central Military Dragon *''[[Ctenophorus maculatus]]'' <small>(Gray, 1831)</small> – Spotted Military Dragon, Spotted Dragon, Spotted Sand-dragon *''[[Ctenophorus maculosus]]'' <small>(Mitchell, 1948)</small> – Lake Eyre Dragon, Salt-Lake Ground-dragon *''[[Ctenophorus mckenziei]]'' <small>(Storr, 1981)</small> – Dwarf Bicycle-dragon, McKenzie's Dragon *''[[Ctenophorus nguyarna]]'' <small>Doughty, Maryan, Melville & Austin, 2007</small> – Lake Disappointment Dragon *''[[Ctenophorus nuchalis]]'' <small>(De Vis, 1884)</small> – Central Netted Dragon, Central Netted Ground-dragon *''[[Ctenophorus ornatus]]'' <small>(Gray, 1845)</small> – Ornate Dragon, Ornate Crevise-dragon *''[[Ctenophorus pictus]]'' <small>([[Wilhelm Peters|W. Peters]], 1866)</small> – Painted Dragon *''[[Ctenophorus reticulatus]]'' <small>(Gray, 1845)</small> – Western Netted Dragon, Western Netted Ground-dragon *''[[Ctenophorus rufescens]]'' <small>(Stirling & Zietz, 1893)</small> – Rusty Crevice-dragon, Rusty Dragon *''[[Ctenophorus salinarum]]'' <small>Storr, 1966</small> – Saltpan Ground-dragon, Claypan Dragon *''[[Ctenophorus scutulatus]]'' <small>(Stirling & Zietz, 1893)</small> – Lozenge-marked Dragon, Lozenge-marked Bicycle-dragon *''[[Ctenophorus tjantjalka]]'' <small>Johnston, 1992</small> – Ochre Dragon *''[[Ctenophorus vadnappa]]'' <small>Houston, 1974</small> – Red-barred Crevice-dragon, Red-barred Dragon *''[[Ctenophorus yinnietharra]]'' <small>(Storr, 1981)</small> – Yinnietharra Crevice-dragon, Yinnietharra Rock Dragon == References == {{commons}} {{wikispecies}} {{Reflist}} {{refbegin}} * {{cite book |last=Browne-Cooper |first= Robert|coauthors= Brian Bush, Brad Maryan, David Robinson |title= Reptiles and Frogs in the Bush: Southwestern Australia|year= 2007|month= |publisher= [[University of Western Australia]] Press|isbn= 978-1-920694-74-6 |pages= 146|chapter= |chapterurl= |quote= Australias most diverse group of dragons}} * Wilson, S & Swan, G. (2003) A Complete Guide to Reptiles of Australia. Second edition. Sydney: New Holland Publ. {{refend}} [[Category:Agamidae]] [[Category:Reptiles of Australia]]
